p: Models with age structure akin to that presented in Eqs. 5.5– 5.7 have been essential components of the planning of rubella vaccination strategies around the world [ 11, 12]. A model as simple as these equations would never be used for formulating policy; furthermore, most age-structured models use the continuous time and age versions and so have the structure of partial differential equations. Nevertheless, Eqs. 5.5– 5.7 illustrate the fundamentals of how to include age in an epidemiological model.
